Description:
Traveling this harsh environment, you spot an unusually ornate stone - it's a monolith, tribute to the sun and the forest. You are passing through a druid's domain, and he or she might just be watching you from the eyes and form of a woodland critter, ready to leap upon you as a mighty wolf, or in the form of an otherworldly creature of the forest. Travelers beware!
Druids are guardians of their domain, be it a lush forest, a barren wasteland, the peak of a mountain, or the depth of the sea. Most druids can transform into various animals, some even able to invent their own fauna and flora to shape their domain, while others forgo nature entirely to focus on studying the old ways of the cosmos.
A druid is a spellcaster heavily attuned to their environment, who can shapeshift into animals, cast nature magic and channel the old powers of the stars themselves.
Weapons: You are Trained in 2 Weapon Categories of choice (e.g. 1-Handed Melee, 2-Handed Ranged, Shields, etc).
Proficiency Requirements: You are Skilled in Nature and have a number of extra non-combat Skills equal to your Intelligence.

~Skilled in Nature~.Effect: Add your Level to all Checks for identifying plants, knowing about nature and the wilds, etc.

Spellcasting.Change: You can change your known Spells and Talents inbetween Adventures.
Spellcasting.Other: All Druid-specific abilities are considered spells (unless stated otherwise).

Mana.Regain: You regain all Mana back inbetween Adventures.

Spellcasting.Recommended Abilities Description: You can provide healing and utility to your team with Healing Surge and Speak With Plants, deal flexible damage and Crowd Control with Poison Burst and Mind Blast, and provide buffs to your party with Wild Heart.

Druidic: Whistletone is the art of conveying information at long distances through whistles, claps and snaps. Druids specifically can also incorporate magic into their Whistletone to mimick the breeze of the wind, the subtle sound of thunder in the distance, or even replicate smells and miasmas to convey hidden messages.

Starting Abilities Description.Druidcraft:
Druids have the ability to create small magical effects that affect plants, animals or just nature.
You can use the Druidcraft Spell in roleplay scenarios to affect the environment and people.

Starting Abilities Description.Shapeshift:
As a Druid, you can tranform into various animals, both in combat and outside of combat.
The Shapeshift Spell provides an infinite amount of options to help out your party in any situation!
You can choose any animal from the Animals list to Shapeshift into, as long as it's not Exotic or non-standard. Each Animal allows you to use its special Ability once per Adventure. You are still only allowed to use that Ability once per Adventure, even if you Shapeshift into that animal twice (the cooldown stays the same).
Other Druid Talents might allow you to Shapeshift into more unusual beasts.
Shapeshift is considered a Spell.

When in Shapeshift form, you always have access to the Animal Attack Ability, which is not considered a Spell.
Animal Attack is, of course, impaired if you are Crippled.

~Druidcraft~.Effect:
{Diamond} You speak Whistletone, a language made up of whistles
{Diamond} You can create harmless sensory effects or tiny weather effects (6 meters range).
{Diamond} You can massively speed up the growth of small plants (touch by touch).
{Diamond} You can slightly soothe physical pains (with no combat effect) (by touch).
{Diamond} You can attempt to convey simple ideas to animals and plants (3 meters range) that you would not normally be able to convey.
{Diamond} You have +3 on rolls for identifying plants, monsters or monster lairs
~Druidcraft~.Notes: You can do these even while Shapeshifted.

~Shapeshift~.Effect:
Pick an animal from the Pets and Animals list, within your Level, and instantly transform into it.

For Checks, you can choose to use the animal's Stats or your Stats.
You also gain its exact Abilities and Animal Attack (see below), but can't cast Spells or use items (obviously).
Your Health stays the same, but you use that animal's Defense.

Shapeshift ends if you drop to 0 Health, and you Fall.
~Shapeshift~.Upgrade:
At first, you can't fly, even if your animal can. If your animal can fly, you have the Jumping Skill and you can glide (you don't take falling Damage).
From Level 3, you can use this 3 times per Adventure.
From Level 6, you can use this 4 times per Adventure and you can fly.
From Level 9, you can use this 5 times per Adventure.
~Shapeshift~.Notes:
You choose what items you keep on you when Shapeshifting, and those items are 'merged' into your new form.
You can turn back into your person form for 0 Actions (on your turn).
While Shapeshifted, you can speak, but your voice is slightly altered to match your shape (e.g. guttural for lions, high pitched for birds, etc).

~Animal Attack~.Effect: Make a melee attack for 1d6 + your Sense (not the animal's).

Specializations.Description: At Level 2, you can choose your coven (Specialization). A coven is a spiritual path you adhere to, and whose culture you represent.
Choices: Coven of the Land, a protector of the flora and fauna specific to your chosen domain
Coven of the Old Ways, using the old magic, worshipping old gods and drawing power from the sun, the moon and the stars
Coven of the Wild, where your true fey or animalistic nature takes shape!

Coven of the Land.Description: The Druid of the Land is a guardian of its own domain. Be it a lush forest, a snowy mountain or a rocky cave, the Druid of the Land knows its own ways.

~Circle of the Land~.Effect: Choose one _domain_. Each _domain_ gives you extra powers.

~Nature Domain~.Effect: You can cast Talent Abilities and Spells from the Nature Basic Ability List while Shapeshifted.

~Water Domain~.Effect: Whenever you heal someone else with a Spell, heal them for another 1d4.
~Water Domain~.Notes: Only works for Acts (doesn't work for Passive or Passive-like Spells).

~Cold Domain~.Effect: You gain +1 on all Resist Checks, +4 Max Health and you only take 50% Cold Damage.

~Rough Domain~.Effect:
After you attack with a real, non-bodily weapon, your next Animal Attack deals an extra 1d4 Damage.
Stacks up to 2 times (maximum bonus of 2d4).
~Rough Domain~.Notes: Only weapons in the weapons list trigger this (e.g. not Improvised Attacks, punching, biting, etc).

<Beastly Fortitude>.Effect: Whenever you Shapeshift into an animal specific to your _domain_, heal for 1d4.
<Beastly Fortitude>.Notes: You are allowed to use the variant animal suggestions for each animal. Of course, some animals can correspond to multiple domains (e.g. bears can live both in nature (forests) and in cold (snowy) domains).

<Innervate>.Effect: Heal another ally for 1d10 Health and it regains 1 Mana or provides 1 more use of an Ability that is on Cooldown.
<Innervate>.Downside: Can not be cast on Druids.

<Stat Bonus 4 Plus>.Effect:
Gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +4.
Gain 2 more non-combat Skills.

<Double Stat Bonus Plus>.Effect: Gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +4, and +1 in another Stat of choice, up to +3.

<Primal Surge>.Effect: Heal yourself for 50% of your missing Health, and all Units within 2 meters for 25% of your missing Health.

<Dazzling Miasma>.Effect:
Shoot a tainted gust of spores in a 10x1 meter line from your position.
It hits the first 2 Units it travels into.
If you hit one Unit, it takes 7d6 Poison Damage.
If you hit 2 Units, each takes 2d10 Poison Damage and is Blinded.

<Druid Animal Companion>.Effect:
You have an animal pet that can fight alongside you, but your Mana pool is permanently decreased by 1, and your total Health by 5.
Your animal has stats depending on its species. Check out the Pets and Animals page to see its stats!
Your pet takes its turn at the same time as you do, and always has the same initiative as yours.
Your pet has 1 Action per turn, which it can use to do its own Abilities.
Your pet can make normal Checks using using its own Stats.
Your pet will not stray more than 30 meters away from you in hostile territory.
All pets have the Pet Attack ability.
<Druid Animal Companion>.Upgrade: If your pet drops to 0 Health, it becomes Fallen, like a player. It has no Health Regen, but at any point outside of combat, you (the pet owner) can spend 30 minutes to tend to your pet's wounds and heal it back to full Health.
<Druid Animal Companion>.Notes: If your pet raises from being Fallen, it has Pet Exhaustion (is Slowed and can only use Pet Attack, but all Pet Attacks have Cover, which is a -2 to the attack).

<Pet Attack>.Effect:
The pet melee attacks a target.
The attack deals 1d6 Pierce of Slash Damage (your choice).

<Regrowth>.Effect:
Choose a Unit.
Now and at the start of your next turn, heal it for 1d10 for each 10 Health it is missing.

<Wicked Animals>.Effect:
Call upon 2 animals, both of which are specific to your _domain_, but have Max Health as if they were 4 Levels lower than you.
They appear on the edge of the battlefield, from the wilderness, and they fight for you for up to 1 minute.
<Wicked Animals>.Notes: Both animals must be of the same type. This is considered a Spell.

<Stat Bonus 5>.Effect: Gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +5.

<Land Bonus>.Effect: Gain one more Level 3 Talent or one more Domain.

Coven of the Wild.Description: You are heavily in touch with nature and with strange creatures, uncommon to the normal folk.

~Wild Shape~.Effect:
After using Shapeshift, you gain back the Half-Action spent on it.
When you use Shapeshift, you can transform into a combination of 2 animals.
You take the highest Stat from both animals, and you have access to both of their Abilities.
~Wild Shape~.Notes:
For example, you could transform into a combination of Bird of Prey and Bear, resulting in a Bowlear, with Shielding and a lot of Defense! Be creative!
The animal size is either the larger or the smaller of the two - your choice.
Even if you Shapeshift into 2 combinations of a same animal, the cooldown of that animal's Ability persists (e.g. you can't use Bear's Maul twice per Adventure, no matter what animal combination you transform into).

<Forest Friend>.Effect:
You have a flying Pixie companion, a very small person with wings.
The Pixie has 5 Defense, 5 Health, 5 meters Movement Speed.
It takes its turn at the same time as you. While in combat, on its turn, it has the equivalen of 1 Action, and can either melee attack for 1 Pulse Damage or heal a non-Fallen Unit for 1 Health. Instead of that, it can also use Taunt or use consumable items like potions or scrolls.
<Forest Friend>.Upgrade:
If it goes more than 50 meters away from you, it becomes unsummoned (you can summon it back by channeling for 10 minuets).
The Pixie has Charisma, Sense and Intelligence equal to yours, but its Dexterity is 0 and its Might is -5.
<Forest Friend>.Notes: The Pixie can stay in your backpack or pocket if you don't want it to take Damage. Decide with your QM whether you or the QM controls the Pixie roleplay-wise, and whether it is sentient. Have fun!

<Treesposition>.Effect:
Touch a large or larger piece of wood and choose one of the following:
1. Teleport near another large or larger piece of wood within 8 meters.
2. Partially enter the piece of wood, becoming camouflaged. You have +5 Stealth until you exit back to your normal space.
You can stay like that for up to 1 hour.
You benefit from Cover while inside a tree.
As a Reaction, you can use this when you are attacked or right when someone casts a spell (before the roll).
<Treesposition>.Notes: If you use this as a Reaction and the attack would fail (out of range, no line of sight, etc), the attacker can then choose a different Act or target.

<Exotic Shapeshift>.Effect:
You can now Shapeshift into Exotic Animals.
You can also use Shapeshift to also transform into other people.
When you want to do this, roll a Deception check.
This check determines how close you get to the form of that person (12 or more means a perfect copy).
This copy just mimicks the look of the person, not the voice or personality.
<Exotic Shapeshift>.Notes:
You can cast your own spells while transformed into someone else.
Other people are not considered Animals, so you can't use Wild Shape to transform into a combination of a person and an Animal.

<Stat Bonus 4 Plus>.Effect:
Gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +4.
Gain 2 more non-combat Skills.

<Double Stat Bonus Plus>.Effect: Gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +4, and +1 in another Stat of choice, up to +3.

<Shapeshift Ally>.Effect:
Passively, you get 2 more uses of Shapeshift per Adventure.
Choose a willing Ally and Shapeshift them into a standard animal of your choice.
They have Animal Attack and all of the animal's Abilities.
They can cancel it for 0 Actions on their turn.

<Strangevolution>.Effect: When you gain this Talent, gain 2 racial Ablities, from any Race(s).

<Dryad Ancestry>.Effect: You can cast Spells while Shapeshifted. Gain 1 extra Max Mana and access to one more Basic Ability List of choice.

<Might Health Bonus>.Effect: Gain Max Health equal to ^Your Might * 2^.

<Weirdvolution>.Effect: Gain 2 Racial Ability Choices from any Race(s).

<Evershape>.Effect: When Shapeshifting yourself, it doesn't consume a ^use^.
<Evershape>.Notes: This means that unless you use Shapeshift Ally, you can Shapeshift as much as you like. Note that the Cooldowns of Animal Abilities persist and don't reset.

<Werebeast Blood>.Effect: You can Shapeshift into a combination of 3 animals. You gain 7 Max Health.
<Werebeast Blood>.Upgrade: In addition, you're free to just choose one animal at first when you use Shapeshift, then freely add animals to the combination if you need their Abilities. Build-a-werebeast, step by step!

<Beastly Stamina>.Effect: For each animal, you gain an extra use of their Abilities that have a Cooldown of Once / Adventure.

Coven of the Old Ways.Description:
You worship the sun, the moon and the stars, for only they can truly guide your path.
Pagan Druids believe no one has the right to dictate someone else's spiritual path.
As a Pagan Druid, you oppose fanaticism, opressors and stupidity.
Pagan Druids usually worship no god, but they do acknowledge their power and they heavily respect nature and the earth.
A Pagan Druid gains the power through not black, nor white magic.
The suggested alignment for Pagan Druids is True Neutral.

~Day Night Cycle~.Effect:
You have access to the Arcane and Elemental Ability Lists, but you can only use Arcane Abilities at _twilight_, and Elemental Abilities at _day_.
You may spend 1 hour of non-combat to change your Known Abilities.
You always know if it's day or night, even if indoors.
~Day Night Cycle~.Notes: _Twilight_ is from 18:00 to 6:00. _Day_ is from 6:00 to 18:00.

~Moonsun Fire~.Effect: A Unit takes 1d6 + Main Stat Fire Damage and is Blinded (if _day_) or True Damage and is Silenced (if _twilight_).

<Improved Moonsun Fire>.Effect:
If _day_, Moonsun Fire also burns the target for 10% of its total Health as Fire Damage.
If _twilight_, Moonsun Fire heals a target you choose within 6 meters for the same Damage dealt.

<Sunrise/Moonfall>.Effect: Moonsun Fire now hits one extra target, deals 1d4 extra Damage and ignores Defense and Resistances.

<Equinox>.Effect: Your next Spell (this turn or next) casts twice.
<Equinox>.Upgrade: If you use this with Shapeshift, you can combine into 2 animals, and have both their Abilities and their highest Stats.
<Equinox>.Notes: On the second cast, you can choose different targets, areas, etc (and it ignores Cooldown, Costs, etc). Works on Spells with cast time longer than 1 Action (e.g. Old Ritualist).

<Druid Animal Companion>.Effect:
You have an animal pet that can fight alongside you, but your Mana pool is permanently decreased by 1, and your total Health by 5.
Your animal has stats depending on its species. Check out the Pets and Animals page to see its stats!
Your pet takes its turn at the same time as you do, and always has the same initiative as yours.
Your pet has 1 Action per turn, which it can use to do its own Abilities.
Your pet can make normal Checks using using its own Stats.
Your pet will not stray more than 30 meters away from you in hostile territory.
All pets have the Pet Attack ability.
<Druid Animal Companion>.Upgrade: If your pet drops to 0 Health, it becomes Fallen, like a player. It has no Health Regen, but at any point outside of combat, you (the pet owner) can spend 30 minutes to tend to your pet's wounds and heal it back to full Health.
<Druid Animal Companion>.Notes: If your pet raises from being Fallen, it has Pet Exhaustion (is Slowed and can only use Pet Attack, but all Pet Attacks have Cover, which is a -2 to the attack).

<Pet Attack>.Effect:
The pet melee attacks a target.
The attack deals 1d6 Pierce of Slash Damage (your choice).

<Shapeshift Fire>.Effect: Whenever you Shapeshift into an animal specific to the current time of day, cast Moonsun Fire for free, ignoring its Cooldown.
<Shapeshift Fire>.Notes: The chosen animal must be approved by the QM to trigger the free Moonsun Fire.

<Star Fall>.Effect: If _day_, heal a Unit for 6d12. If _twilight_, deal 7d6 Pulse Damage to a Unit.

<Forced Eclipse>.Effect: Through ancient weather witchcraft, you force 1 minute of artificial day or night in a 1km area around you.
<Forced Eclipse>.Upgrade: This can reset the Cooldown of Moonsun Fire's, once when it happens, and again when it ends.
<Forced Eclipse>.Notes: Nothing happens if used with Equinox.
